taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family pottiaceae;subfamily barbuloideae;genus plaubelia;species sprengelii;variety sprengelii

bio:treatment.description: Leaves apiculate; costa percurrent to excurrent; adaxial distal laminal cells mammillose, smooth on both surfaces.
Capsules mature winter (late Dec, Feb) to spring.
Shaded or exposed moist limestone, quarries, brick mortar, stream banks;

verbatim.text: Capsules mature winter (late Dec, Feb) to spring. Shaded or exposed moist limestone, quarries, brick mortar, stream banks; low elevations; Fla.; Mexico; West Indies; Central America; South America (Brazil, Venezuela).

parsed.phenology: Capsules mature winter (late Dec, Feb) to spring.
parsed.habitat: Shaded or exposed moist limestone, quarries, brick mortar, stream banks;
parsed.distribution: Fla.; Mexico; West Indies; Central America; South America (Brazil, Venezuela).

bio:treatment.discussion: The citation for Georgia by H. A. Crum and L. E. Anderson (1981) may have been based on a specimen here redetermined as Hyophila involuta (Anderson & Crum 13658, CANM, DUKE).
